oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of John Chamberlain to Mistress Alice Carleton
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chamberlain, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Theater--England--London--History--17th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Chamberlain (1553-1628) was a professional letter-writer employed by contemporaries who preserved his letters in considerable numbers. Chief among his employers was Sir Dudley Carlteton (1574-1632), Viscount Dorchester, a career diplomat who served in Venice from 1610 to 1615. (Carleton was admitted to Gray's Inn in 1605). Carleton's sister Alice was a favourite of Chamberlain. This letter, dated 18 February 1612/13, describes the performance events staged for the wedding of Princess Elizabeth to Frederick, Elector Palatine.
